pages.text: Had We made him an angel, We would have sent him as a man, thus obscuring for them that which they themselves obscure
Messengers have surely been mocked before thee. Then those who scoffed at them were beset by that which they used to mock
Say, “Journey upon the earth and behold how the deniers fared in the end.”

Say, “Unto whom belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and on the earth?” Say, “Unto God. He has prescribed Mercy for Himself. He will surely gather you on the Day of Resurrection, in which there is no doubt. Those who have lost their souls, they do not believe
Unto Him belongs all that dwells in the night and in the day, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.”

Say, “Shall I take as a protector anyone other than God, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, who feeds and is not fed?” Say, “I was commanded to be the first of those who submit.” And be not among the idolaters
Say, “Truly I fear the punishment of a tremendous Day should I disobey my Lord.”
Whosoever is spared on that Day, He has certainly been merciful unto him, and that is the manifest triumph
If God should touch thee with affliction, none can remove it save He, and should He touch thee with goodness, then He is Powerful over all things
He is Dominant over His servants; and He is the Wise, the Aware
